item.title: IEEE Quantum Week in Albuquerque: AI and Quantum Computing at IBM Quantum
item.description:
üöÄ Excited to be attending IEEE Quantum Week in Albuquerque, New Mexico! I’ll be sharing some of the work we’re doing at IBM Quantum, especially at the intersection of AI and Quantum Computing. If you’re around and passionate about Quantum, AI, or both‚Äîlet’s connect! Here’s where you can find me:

üß† Today, Sunday, August 31 ‚Äì 4:00PM Paper Presentation: “Quantum Processing Unit (QPU) Processing Time Prediction with Machine Learning”. We’ll explore how ML can improve QPU time prediction for quantum jobs‚Äîenabling smarter quantum workload scheduling.

üõ†Ô∏è Monday, September 1 ‚Äì 10:00AM Tutorial: “TUT13 ‚Äî AI Methods for Quantum Circuit Optimization”. Together with David Kremer, we’ll demonstrate how Reinforcement Learning can be used to transpile and synthesize quantum circuits, using qiskit-ibm-transpiler and other tools developed by our team.

üí° Tuesday, September 2 ‚Äì 12:00PM Live Demo at IBM Quantum Booth #400. I’ll demo our new AI-powered quantum computing development environment‚Äîdesigned to bridge the gap between quantum theory and practical implementation in a visual way.

If you’re attending and want to talk about AI for Quantum, Quantum+AI, or our work at IBM Quantum‚Äîfeel free to reach out or stop by!

#IEEEQuantumWeek #IBMQuantum #QuantumComputing #AIforQuantum #QuantumPlusAI

Originally shared on LinkedIn on August 31, 2025 - 42 reactions, 2 comments as of 11/12/2025

item.title: IEEE Quantum Week 2024: Showcasing AI-Powered Quantum Tools
item.description:
Las week I attended to the IEEE Quantum Week and it was a blast! üöÄüî¨

I had the opportunity to witness and showcase several groundbreaking developments from IBM Quantum AI:

üîπ Qiskit Transpiler Service: Jay Gambetta presented impressive results showing how our AI-powered optimization passes outperformed all competitors in benchpress regarding depth and number of gates, including Qiskit itself!

üîπ Qiskit Code Assistant: We announced the first preview release of this innovative tool.

üîπ Unitary Compilation Research: David Kremer presented our work on approximate compiling of unitaries in quantum circuits using AI. We also co-delivered a tutorial on AI-powered transpiler passes.

üîπ Qiskit HumanEval: I had the chance to present this benchmark for evaluating quantum software development tools.

It was an incredible week of innovation, collaboration, and pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in quantum computing!

#QuantumComputing #IEEEQuantumWeek #Qiskit #AIforQuantum #QisktiCodeAssistant #QiskitTranspilerService #ResearchHighlights

Originally shared on LinkedIn on September 24, 2024 - 71 reactions, 0 comments as of 11/12/2025

item.title: Presenting Qiskit HumanEval at IEEE Quantum Week 2024
item.description:
Hey! If you are at the #IEEEQuantumWeek 2024, I will be talking about the Qiskit HumanEval benchmark for LLMs in the session SYS-BNCH: Benchmarking (10:00 AM ‚Äì 11:30 AM EDT)

After that, I’ll be around the IBM Quantum booth to chat about our AI and quantum computing initiatives. Looking forward to connecting with the community!

Originally shared on LinkedIn on September 18, 2024 - 51 reactions, 0 comments as of 11/12/2025
